meanings.definition: In a manner that does not use force or threats to persuade or control someone.
meanings.sent1: She spoke uncoercively, gently encouraging her friend to try the new hobby.
meanings.sent2: He always prefers to resolve conflicts uncoercively, through calm discussion.
meanings.sent3: The teacher uncoercively convinced the students to participate in the class play.
meanings.sent4: The sunlight streamed in uncoercively through the window, brightening the room.
meanings.sent5: The river flowed uncoercively, following its natural path through the valley.

meanings.definition: Without the use of coercion or pressure.
meanings.sent1: The charity organization operates uncoercively, relying on donations to help those in need.
meanings.sent2: The team members collaborated uncoercively, each contributing their ideas willingly.
meanings.sent3: The cat uncoercively convinced its owner to open the door by meowing softly.
meanings.sent4: The idea spread uncoercively throughout the community, gaining support organically.
meanings.sent5: The flowers bloomed uncoercively, soaking up the sunlight and water to grow beautifully.
